ns8:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to install the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK ERROR function check_response_code() { if [ "$?" = "0" ]; then echo "DATABASE INSTALLED SUCCESSFULLY"; else error_exit "UNSUCCESSFUL INSTALLATION. ERROR CODE $?"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE THE INTEGER function valid_int() { local data=$1 if [[ $data =~ ^[0-9]{1,9}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1 fi }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE NAME STRING function valid_string() { local data=$1 if [[ $data =~ ^[A-Za-z]{1,}[A-Za-z0-9_-]{1,}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1; fi }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE PASSWORD function valid_password() { local data=$1 length=${#data} if [ $length -le 6 ]; then check_error "PASSWORD MUST BE OF AT LEAST 6 CHARACTERS" else if [[ $data =~ ^[A-Za-z]{1,}[0-9_@$%^+=]{0,}[A-Za-z0-9]{0,}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1; fi fi }
# FUNCTION TO CHECK THE DB2 INSTALLATION TYPE function check_install_type() { len=${#INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY[*]} local temp=$1; for (( i=0; $i < $len; i++ )) do if [ "${INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY[$i]}" = "$temp" ]; then return; fi done error_exit "INVALID INSTALLATION TYPE. Valid values are - WORKGROUP_SERVER_EDITION ENTERPRISE_SERVER_EDITION EXPRESS_EDITION PERSONAL_EDITION" } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START DOWNLOAD_URL="$download_url" PORT_NUMBER="$port_number" INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME="$instance_group_name" FENCED_USER_NAME="$fenced_user_name" FENCED_GROUP_NAME="$fenced_group_name" INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" INSTANCE_PASSWORD="$instance_password" INSTALLATION_DIR="$installation_dir" INSTALLATION_TYPE="$installation_type" RESPONSE_FILE="/tmp/db2.rsp" INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY=(WORKGROUP_SERVER_EDITION ENTERPRISE_SERVER_EDITION EXPRESS_EDITION PERSONAL_EDITION) DATABASE_NAME="$database_name" DATABASE_USERNAME="$database_username" DATABASE_PASSWORD="$database_password" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ################################## #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- START echo "VALIDATING PARAMETERS..." if [ "x${DOWNLOAD_URL}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DOWNLOAD URL NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE GROUP NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE GROUP NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${FENCED_USER_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "FENCED USER NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${FENCED_USER_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER FENCED USER NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${FENCED_GROUP_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "FENCED GROUP NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${FENCED_GROUP_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER FENCED GROUP NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${INSTANCE_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_PASSWORD}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE PASSWORD NOT SET." else if ! valid_password ${INSTANCE_PASSWORD}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE PASSWORD." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTALLATION_DIR}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALLATION DIR NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTALLATION_TYPE}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALLATION TYPE NOT SET." else check_install_type "$INSTALLATION_TYPE" fi
if [ "x${PORT_NUMBER}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "PORT NUMBER NOT SET." else if ! valid_int ${PORT_NUMBER}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER PORT NUMBER.MUST BE AN INTEGER" fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${DATABASE_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_USERNAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE USERNAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${DATABASE_USERNAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE USERNAME." fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_PASSWORD}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE PASSWORD NOT SET." else if ! valid_password ${DATABASE_PASSWORD}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE PASSWORD." fi fi
echo "PARAMTER VALIDATION -- DONE" #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- END
# SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START # CREATING SILENT RESPONSE FILE FOR THE DB2 INSTALLATION echo "CREATING REPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE..." cat <<EOF> $RESPONSE_FILE PROD = $INSTALLATION_TYPE FILE = $INSTALLATION_DIR LIC_AGREEMENT = ACCEPT INSTALL_TYPE = TYPICAL INSTANCE = DB2_INST DB2_INST.NAME = $INSTANCE_NAME DB2_INST.PASSWORD = $INSTANCE_PASSWORD DB2_INST.GROUP_NAME = $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME DB2_INST.AUTOSTART = YES DB2_INST.START_DURING_INSTALL = YES DB2_INST.FENCED_USERNAME = $FENCED_USER_NAME DB2_INST.FENCED_GROUP_NAME = $FENCED_GROUP_NAME DB2_INST.PORT_NUMBER = $PORT_NUMBER DATABASE = MY_DB MY_DB.INSTANCE = DB2_INST MY_DB.DATABASE_NAME = $DATABASE_NAME MY_DB.LOCATION = LOCAL MY_DB.ALIAS = $DATABASE_NAME MY_DB.USERNAME = $DATABASE_USERNAME MY_DB.PASSWORD = $DATABASE_PASSWORD EOF check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE" echo "RESPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY!"
# INSTALLING IBM DB2 -- START cd /tmp # DOWNLOADING TAR BALL echo "DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL OF THE DB2..." wget --output-document=installer.tar.gz $DOWNLOAD_URL check_error "ERROR WHILE DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL OF THE DB2" echo "DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL -- DONE"
# EXTRACTING TAR BALL echo "EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL..." tar xvfz installer.tar.gz check_error "ERROR WHILE EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL" echo "EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] ; then echo "RHEL / CENTOS OS" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." yum --nogpgcheck -y install libaio-devel check_error "ERROR WHILE LIBAIO-DEVEL PACKAGE" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES -- DONE"
# CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS" groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -s /bin/bash -d /home/$FENCED_USER_NAME $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -s /bin/bash -d /home/$INSTANCE_NAME $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error" elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ] ; then echo "Ubuntu OS" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." apt-get -f -y install linux-firmware --fix-missing apt-get -f -y install libaio1 --fix-missing check_error "ERROR WHILE LIBAIO-DEVEL PACKAGE" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES -- DONE"
# CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS" groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -m $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -m $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE -f sysreq echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error"
elif [ -f /etc/SuSE-release ] ; then echo "SUSE OS" # CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS..." groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -m $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -m $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE -f sysreq echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error" fi
# LOGGING echo "RESPONSE FILE" cat $RESPONSE_FILE
echo "DB2 SETUP LOG" cat /tmp/db2setup.log # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

ns8:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to configure the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # # Configuration involves creation of a table on the DB2 database. # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:$installation_dir/adm:$installation_dir/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" DATABASE_NAME="$database_name" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ##################################### # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT..." su $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR: UNABLE TO SWITCH TO $INSTANCE_NAME USER." cd /home/$INSTANCE_NAME/sqllib chmod 777 db2profile ./db2profile check_error "ERROR: WHILE SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT" echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT -- DONE"
echo "CONNECTING TO THE $DATABASE_NAME..." db2 "Connect to $DATABASE_NAME" check_error "ERROR: WHILE CONNECTING TO DB2 DATABASE" echo "CONNECTING TO THE $DATABASE_NAME -- DONE"
echo "CREATING A TABLE ON $DATABASE_NAME..." db2 "create table emp1 ( firstname varchar(30),lastname varchar(30),emailid varchar(30),role varchar(30),project varchar(30),mobile varchar(30))" check_error "ERROR: WHILE CREATING TABLE ON DB2 DATABASE" echo "CREATING A TABLE ON $DATABASE_NAME -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

ns8:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to restart the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/home/$instance_name/sqllib/adm:$installation_dir/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ##################################### # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT..." su $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR: UNABLE TO SWITCH TO $INSTANCE_NAME USER." cd /home/${INSTANCE_NAME}/sqllib chmod 777 db2profile ./db2profile check_error "ERROR: WHILE SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT" echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT -- DONE"
# STOP DB2 SERVICE echo "STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE..." db2stop force check_error "ERROR: WHILE STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE." echo "STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE -- DONE"
# START DB2 SERVICE echo "STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE..." db2start check_error "ERROR: WHILE STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE." echo "STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

ns8:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to install the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK ERROR function check_response_code() { if [ "$?" = "0" ]; then echo "DATABASE INSTALLED SUCCESSFULLY"; else error_exit "UNSUCCESSFUL INSTALLATION. ERROR CODE $?"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE THE INTEGER function valid_int() { local data=$1 if [[ $data =~ ^[0-9]{1,9}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1 fi }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE NAME STRING function valid_string() { local data=$1 if [[ $data =~ ^[A-Za-z]{1,}[A-Za-z0-9_-]{1,}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1; fi }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE PASSWORD function valid_password() { local data=$1 length=${#data} if [ $length -le 6 ]; then check_error "PASSWORD MUST BE OF AT LEAST 6 CHARACTERS" else if [[ $data =~ ^[A-Za-z]{1,}[0-9_@$%^+=]{0,}[A-Za-z0-9]{0,}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1; fi fi }
# FUNCTION TO CHECK THE DB2 INSTALLATION TYPE function check_install_type() { len=${#INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY[*]} local temp=$1; for (( i=0; $i < $len; i++ )) do if [ "${INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY[$i]}" = "$temp" ]; then return; fi done error_exit "INVALID INSTALLATION TYPE. Valid values are - WORKGROUP_SERVER_EDITION ENTERPRISE_SERVER_EDITION EXPRESS_EDITION PERSONAL_EDITION" } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START DOWNLOAD_URL="$download_url" PORT_NUMBER="$port_number" INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME="$instance_group_name" FENCED_USER_NAME="$fenced_user_name" FENCED_GROUP_NAME="$fenced_group_name" INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" INSTANCE_PASSWORD="$instance_password" INSTALLATION_DIR="$installation_dir" INSTALLATION_TYPE="$installation_type" RESPONSE_FILE="/tmp/db2.rsp" INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY=(WORKGROUP_SERVER_EDITION ENTERPRISE_SERVER_EDITION EXPRESS_EDITION PERSONAL_EDITION) DATABASE_NAME="$database_name" DATABASE_USERNAME="$database_username" DATABASE_PASSWORD="$database_password" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ################################## #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- START echo "VALIDATING PARAMETERS..." if [ "x${DOWNLOAD_URL}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DOWNLOAD URL NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE GROUP NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE GROUP NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${FENCED_USER_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "FENCED USER NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${FENCED_USER_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER FENCED USER NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${FENCED_GROUP_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "FENCED GROUP NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${FENCED_GROUP_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER FENCED GROUP NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${INSTANCE_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_PASSWORD}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE PASSWORD NOT SET." else if ! valid_password ${INSTANCE_PASSWORD}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE PASSWORD." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTALLATION_DIR}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALLATION DIR NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTALLATION_TYPE}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALLATION TYPE NOT SET." else check_install_type "$INSTALLATION_TYPE" fi
if [ "x${PORT_NUMBER}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "PORT NUMBER NOT SET." else if ! valid_int ${PORT_NUMBER}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER PORT NUMBER.MUST BE AN INTEGER" fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${DATABASE_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_USERNAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE USERNAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${DATABASE_USERNAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE USERNAME." fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_PASSWORD}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE PASSWORD NOT SET." else if ! valid_password ${DATABASE_PASSWORD}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE PASSWORD." fi fi
echo "PARAMTER VALIDATION -- DONE" #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- END
# SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START # CREATING SILENT RESPONSE FILE FOR THE DB2 INSTALLATION echo "CREATING REPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE..." cat <<EOF> $RESPONSE_FILE PROD = $INSTALLATION_TYPE FILE = $INSTALLATION_DIR LIC_AGREEMENT = ACCEPT INSTALL_TYPE = TYPICAL INSTANCE = DB2_INST DB2_INST.NAME = $INSTANCE_NAME DB2_INST.PASSWORD = $INSTANCE_PASSWORD DB2_INST.GROUP_NAME = $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME DB2_INST.AUTOSTART = YES DB2_INST.START_DURING_INSTALL = YES DB2_INST.FENCED_USERNAME = $FENCED_USER_NAME DB2_INST.FENCED_GROUP_NAME = $FENCED_GROUP_NAME DB2_INST.PORT_NUMBER = $PORT_NUMBER DATABASE = MY_DB MY_DB.INSTANCE = DB2_INST MY_DB.DATABASE_NAME = $DATABASE_NAME MY_DB.LOCATION = LOCAL MY_DB.ALIAS = $DATABASE_NAME MY_DB.USERNAME = $DATABASE_USERNAME MY_DB.PASSWORD = $DATABASE_PASSWORD EOF check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE" echo "RESPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY!"
# INSTALLING IBM DB2 -- START cd /tmp # DOWNLOADING TAR BALL echo "DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL OF THE DB2..." wget --output-document=installer.tar.gz $DOWNLOAD_URL check_error "ERROR WHILE DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL OF THE DB2" echo "DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL -- DONE"
# EXTRACTING TAR BALL echo "EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL..." tar xvfz installer.tar.gz check_error "ERROR WHILE EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL" echo "EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] ; then echo "RHEL / CENTOS OS" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." yum --nogpgcheck -y install libaio-devel check_error "ERROR WHILE LIBAIO-DEVEL PACKAGE" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES -- DONE"
# CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS" groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -s /bin/bash -d /home/$FENCED_USER_NAME $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -s /bin/bash -d /home/$INSTANCE_NAME $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error" elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ] ; then echo "Ubuntu OS" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." apt-get -f -y install linux-firmware --fix-missing apt-get -f -y install libaio1 --fix-missing check_error "ERROR WHILE LIBAIO-DEVEL PACKAGE" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES -- DONE"
# CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS" groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -m $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -m $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE -f sysreq echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error"
elif [ -f /etc/SuSE-release ] ; then echo "SUSE OS" # CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS..." groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -m $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -m $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE -f sysreq echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error" fi
# LOGGING echo "RESPONSE FILE" cat $RESPONSE_FILE
echo "DB2 SETUP LOG" cat /tmp/db2setup.log # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

ns8:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to configure the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # # Configuration involves creation of a table on the DB2 database. # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:$installation_dir/adm:$installation_dir/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" DATABASE_NAME="$database_name" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ##################################### # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT..." su $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR: UNABLE TO SWITCH TO $INSTANCE_NAME USER." cd /home/$INSTANCE_NAME/sqllib chmod 777 db2profile ./db2profile check_error "ERROR: WHILE SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT" echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT -- DONE"
echo "CONNECTING TO THE $DATABASE_NAME..." db2 "Connect to $DATABASE_NAME" check_error "ERROR: WHILE CONNECTING TO DB2 DATABASE" echo "CONNECTING TO THE $DATABASE_NAME -- DONE"
echo "CREATING A TABLE ON $DATABASE_NAME..." db2 "create table emp1 ( firstname varchar(30),lastname varchar(30),emailid varchar(30),role varchar(30),project varchar(30),mobile varchar(30))" check_error "ERROR: WHILE CREATING TABLE ON DB2 DATABASE" echo "CREATING A TABLE ON $DATABASE_NAME -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

ns8:component-version-script.script:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to restart the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/home/$instance_name/sqllib/adm:$installation_dir/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ##################################### # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT..." su $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR: UNABLE TO SWITCH TO $INSTANCE_NAME USER." cd /home/${INSTANCE_NAME}/sqllib chmod 777 db2profile ./db2profile check_error "ERROR: WHILE SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT" echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT -- DONE"
# STOP DB2 SERVICE echo "STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE..." db2stop force check_error "ERROR: WHILE STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE." echo "STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE -- DONE"
# START DB2 SERVICE echo "STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE..." db2start check_error "ERROR: WHILE STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE." echo "STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

task.content:
################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to install the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK ERROR function check_response_code() { if [ "$?" = "0" ]; then echo "DATABASE INSTALLED SUCCESSFULLY"; else error_exit "UNSUCCESSFUL INSTALLATION. ERROR CODE $?"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE THE INTEGER function valid_int() { local data=$1 if [[ $data =~ ^[0-9]{1,9}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1 fi }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE NAME STRING function valid_string() { local data=$1 if [[ $data =~ ^[A-Za-z]{1,}[A-Za-z0-9_-]{1,}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1; fi }
# FUNCTION TO VALIDATE PASSWORD function valid_password() { local data=$1 length=${#data} if [ $length -le 6 ]; then check_error "PASSWORD MUST BE OF AT LEAST 6 CHARACTERS" else if [[ $data =~ ^[A-Za-z]{1,}[0-9_@$%^+=]{0,}[A-Za-z0-9]{0,}$ ]]; then return 0; else return 1; fi fi }
# FUNCTION TO CHECK THE DB2 INSTALLATION TYPE function check_install_type() { len=${#INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY[*]} local temp=$1; for (( i=0; $i < $len; i++ )) do if [ "${INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY[$i]}" = "$temp" ]; then return; fi done error_exit "INVALID INSTALLATION TYPE. Valid values are - WORKGROUP_SERVER_EDITION ENTERPRISE_SERVER_EDITION EXPRESS_EDITION PERSONAL_EDITION" } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START DOWNLOAD_URL="$download_url" PORT_NUMBER="$port_number" INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME="$instance_group_name" FENCED_USER_NAME="$fenced_user_name" FENCED_GROUP_NAME="$fenced_group_name" INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" INSTANCE_PASSWORD="$instance_password" INSTALLATION_DIR="$installation_dir" INSTALLATION_TYPE="$installation_type" RESPONSE_FILE="/tmp/db2.rsp" INSTALL_EDITION_ARRAY=(WORKGROUP_SERVER_EDITION ENTERPRISE_SERVER_EDITION EXPRESS_EDITION PERSONAL_EDITION) DATABASE_NAME="$database_name" DATABASE_USERNAME="$database_username" DATABASE_PASSWORD="$database_password" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ################################## #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- START echo "VALIDATING PARAMETERS..." if [ "x${DOWNLOAD_URL}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DOWNLOAD URL NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE GROUP NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE GROUP NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${FENCED_USER_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "FENCED USER NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${FENCED_USER_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER FENCED USER NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${FENCED_GROUP_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "FENCED GROUP NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${FENCED_GROUP_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER FENCED GROUP NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${INSTANCE_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTANCE_PASSWORD}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTANCE PASSWORD NOT SET." else if ! valid_password ${INSTANCE_PASSWORD}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER INSTANCE PASSWORD." fi fi
if [ "x${INSTALLATION_DIR}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALLATION DIR NOT SET." fi
if [ "x${INSTALLATION_TYPE}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "INSTALLATION TYPE NOT SET." else check_install_type "$INSTALLATION_TYPE" fi
if [ "x${PORT_NUMBER}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "PORT NUMBER NOT SET." else if ! valid_int ${PORT_NUMBER}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER PORT NUMBER.MUST BE AN INTEGER" fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_NAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE NAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${DATABASE_NAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE NAME." fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_USERNAME}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE USERNAME NOT SET." else if ! valid_string ${DATABASE_USERNAME}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE USERNAME." fi fi
if [ "x${DATABASE_PASSWORD}" = "x" ]; then error_exit "DATABASE PASSWORD NOT SET." else if ! valid_password ${DATABASE_PASSWORD}; then error_exit "INVALID PARAMETER DATABASE PASSWORD." fi fi
echo "PARAMTER VALIDATION -- DONE" #PARAMETER VALIDATION -- END
# SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START # CREATING SILENT RESPONSE FILE FOR THE DB2 INSTALLATION echo "CREATING REPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE..." cat <<EOF> $RESPONSE_FILE PROD = $INSTALLATION_TYPE FILE = $INSTALLATION_DIR LIC_AGREEMENT = ACCEPT INSTALL_TYPE = TYPICAL INSTANCE = DB2_INST DB2_INST.NAME = $INSTANCE_NAME DB2_INST.PASSWORD = $INSTANCE_PASSWORD DB2_INST.GROUP_NAME = $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME DB2_INST.AUTOSTART = YES DB2_INST.START_DURING_INSTALL = YES DB2_INST.FENCED_USERNAME = $FENCED_USER_NAME DB2_INST.FENCED_GROUP_NAME = $FENCED_GROUP_NAME DB2_INST.PORT_NUMBER = $PORT_NUMBER DATABASE = MY_DB MY_DB.INSTANCE = DB2_INST MY_DB.DATABASE_NAME = $DATABASE_NAME MY_DB.LOCATION = LOCAL MY_DB.ALIAS = $DATABASE_NAME MY_DB.USERNAME = $DATABASE_USERNAME MY_DB.PASSWORD = $DATABASE_PASSWORD EOF check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE" echo "RESPONSE FILE $RESPONSE_FILE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY!"
# INSTALLING IBM DB2 -- START cd /tmp # DOWNLOADING TAR BALL echo "DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL OF THE DB2..." wget --output-document=installer.tar.gz $DOWNLOAD_URL check_error "ERROR WHILE DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL OF THE DB2" echo "DOWNLOADING THE TAR BALL -- DONE"
# EXTRACTING TAR BALL echo "EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL..." tar xvfz installer.tar.gz check_error "ERROR WHILE EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL" echo "EXTRACTING THE TAR BALL -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] ; then echo "RHEL / CENTOS OS" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." yum --nogpgcheck -y install libaio-devel check_error "ERROR WHILE LIBAIO-DEVEL PACKAGE" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES -- DONE"
# CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS" groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -s /bin/bash -d /home/$FENCED_USER_NAME $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -s /bin/bash -d /home/$INSTANCE_NAME $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error" elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ] ; then echo "Ubuntu OS" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES..." apt-get -f -y install linux-firmware --fix-missing apt-get -f -y install libaio1 --fix-missing check_error "ERROR WHILE LIBAIO-DEVEL PACKAGE" echo "INSTALLING PRE-REQUISTES -- DONE"
# CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS" groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -m $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED GROUPS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -m $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE -f sysreq echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error"
elif [ -f /etc/SuSE-release ] ; then echo "SUSE OS" # CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS..." groupadd $FENCED_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" useradd -g $FENCED_GROUP_NAME -m $FENCED_USER_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" groupadd $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" useradd -g $INSTANCE_GROUP_NAME -m $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR WHILE CREATING REQUIRED USERS" echo "CREATING REQUIRED USERS AND GROUPS -- DONE"
# INSTALLING DB2 echo "INSTALLING DB2..." /tmp/server/db2setup -r $RESPONSE_FILE -f sysreq echo "RESPONSE CODE $?" check_response_code "Error" fi
# LOGGING echo "RESPONSE FILE" cat $RESPONSE_FILE
echo "DB2 SETUP LOG" cat /tmp/db2setup.log # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to configure the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # # Configuration involves creation of a table on the DB2 database. # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:$installation_dir/adm:$installation_dir/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" DATABASE_NAME="$database_name" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ##################################### # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT..." su $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR: UNABLE TO SWITCH TO $INSTANCE_NAME USER." cd /home/$INSTANCE_NAME/sqllib chmod 777 db2profile ./db2profile check_error "ERROR: WHILE SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT" echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT -- DONE"
echo "CONNECTING TO THE $DATABASE_NAME..." db2 "Connect to $DATABASE_NAME" check_error "ERROR: WHILE CONNECTING TO DB2 DATABASE" echo "CONNECTING TO THE $DATABASE_NAME -- DONE"
echo "CREATING A TABLE ON $DATABASE_NAME..." db2 "create table emp1 ( firstname varchar(30),lastname varchar(30),emailid varchar(30),role varchar(30),project varchar(30),mobile varchar(30))" check_error "ERROR: WHILE CREATING TABLE ON DB2 DATABASE" echo "CREATING A TABLE ON $DATABASE_NAME -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END

################################################################################################# # PURPOSE: This script is used to restart the IBM DB2 Database Server on the linux machine # #################################################################################################
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/home/$instance_name/sqllib/adm:$installation_dir/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# IMPORT GLOBAL CONFIGURATION DATA FROM APPLICATIONDIRECTOR . $global_conf
########################## INTERNAL FUNCTIONS REGION ################################## # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- START # FUNCTION TO CHECK EXIT SUCCESSFULL EXIT CODE OF A COMMAND function check_error() { if [ ! "$?" = "0" ]; then error_exit "$1"; fi }
# FUNCTION TO DISPLAY ERROR AND EXIT function error_exit() { echo "${PROGNAME}: ${1:-"Unknown Error"}" 1>&2 exit 1 } # VALIDATION FUNCTIONS -- END
########################## INTERNAL PARAMETERS REGION ################################## # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- START INSTANCE_NAME="$instance_name" # INTERNAL PARAMETERS -- END
########################## SCRIPT EXECUTION REGION ##################################### # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- START
# SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT..." su $INSTANCE_NAME check_error "ERROR: UNABLE TO SWITCH TO $INSTANCE_NAME USER." cd /home/${INSTANCE_NAME}/sqllib chmod 777 db2profile ./db2profile check_error "ERROR: WHILE SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT" echo "SETTING UP THE DB2 ENVIRONMENT -- DONE"
# STOP DB2 SERVICE echo "STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE..." db2stop force check_error "ERROR: WHILE STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE." echo "STOPPING THE DB2 SERVICE -- DONE"
# START DB2 SERVICE echo "STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE..." db2start check_error "ERROR: WHILE STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE." echo "STARTING THE DB2 SERVICE -- DONE" # SCRIPT EXECUTION -- END
